title: Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh
summary: Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh (born Prince Philip of Greece and Denmark,[2] later Philip Mountbatten; 10 June 1921[fn 1] â€“ 9 April 2021), was the husband of Queen Elizabeth II. He was the consort of the British monarch from Elizabeth's accession on 6 February 1952 until his death in 2021, making him the longest-serving royal consort in history.
